meanings.definition: A boy employed to run errands and do odd jobs in a newspaper office.
meanings.sent1: The copyboys at the newspaper office quickly delivered messages to different departments.
meanings.sent2: The copyboys were always busy helping out with various tasks around the office.
meanings.sent3: The copyboys decided to have a race to see who could deliver a message the fastest.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling newspaper office, the copyboys were like busy bees buzzing around.
meanings.sent5: The copyboys were known for their swift and efficient errand-running skills.

meanings.definition: A boy who assists in making copies of documents or manuscripts.
meanings.sent1: The copyboys carefully operated the copying machine to reproduce important documents.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, the copyboys would prepare the equipment for copying tasks.
meanings.sent3: One of the copyboys accidentally made a copy of his own hand instead of the document.
meanings.sent4: The copyboys' work was like creating echoes of the original documents.
meanings.sent5: The copyboys took pride in their role of duplicating manuscripts accurately.
